meanings.definition: A device that emits a beeping sound, typically used for tracking or communication.
meanings.sent1: I heard the bleepers of the alarm clock in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The technician used a bleepers to locate the lost keys.
meanings.sent3: The bleepers on the microwave were so loud, they startled the cat!
meanings.sent4: The bleepers of the heart monitor kept a steady rhythm throughout the night.
meanings.sent5: The bleepers on the radar screen warned of an incoming storm.

meanings.definition: People who beep or make beeping sounds.
meanings.sent1: The bleepers in the audience cheered loudly at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The bleepers at the construction site signaled the start of the workday.
meanings.sent3: The bleepers in the park were imitating the sounds of the birds.
meanings.sent4: Among the bleepers at the party, his laugh stood out the most.
meanings.sent5: The bleepers in the choir harmonized beautifully during the performance.

meanings.definition: The act of beeping or emitting a beeping sound.
meanings.sent1: The sudden bleepers from the car startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: The bleepers of the smoke detector warned of a fire in the building.
meanings.sent3: The bleepers during the movie added an unexpected soundtrack.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet library, the bleepers of the phone were especially disruptive.
meanings.sent5: The bleepers of the alarm system echoed through the empty hallway.
